Reproducible analysis functions

R code generator will leverage these functions to mimic analysis performed in the app

app_methods()

Find the proper function to apply to each statistical and column block pairing and use the metadata associated with each column block for the function's arguments

cleanADAE()

Function to clean and combine ADAE dataset with ADSL

col_for_list_expr()

GT Column Names

combineBDS()

Function to bind data rows from the list of user supplied data frames

common_rownames()

Identify Names of Columns

data_to_use_str()

Function to clean and combine ADAE dataset with ADSL

prep_adae()

Function to pre-filter the ADAE depending on the stan table selected

prep_adsl()

Function to pre-filter the ADSL depending on the stan table selected

pretty_blocks

Table Generator Pretty Block lookup table

readData()

Function to read the SAS list of user supplied data frames

Help compare output to SAS functions

User friendly utility functions built for comparing app output with SAS produced outputs

prep_sas_table()

Organize SAS into a format for comparing

prep_tg_table()

Organize Table Generator table into a format for comparing

General helper functions

getLevels()

getLevels function

varN_fctr_reorder()

Re-order Factor Levels by VARN

Table Generator Functions

app_anova()

Generate ANOVA using table generator blocks

app_chg()

Generate change from baseline summary statistics using table generator blocks

app_freq()

Generate frequency of categorical variables using table generator blocks

app_max_freq()

Generate frequency where each subject is only counted once for the maximum VAR

app_mean()

Generate summary statistics using table generator blocks

app_nested_freq()

Generate frequency where each subject is only counted once for the maximum VAR

app_non_missing()

Generate frequency of categorical variables using table generator blocks

app_y()

Generate frequency of categorical variables using table generator blocks
